TextInput.name: is
TextInput.description: Changes the HTML tag used for rendering the TextInput.

TextInput.name: type
TextInput.description: Sets which type of text is being accepted.

TextInput.name: size
TextInput.description: Renders the TextInput at a different sizes.

TextInput.name: variation
TextInput.description: Alters the rendered appearance of the TextInput.

TextInput.name: disabled
TextInput.description: Renders the TextInput with disabled attribute, and styles the TextInput partially transparent.

TextInput.name: required
TextInput.description: Sets if the TextInput should be required, which will fail submission on a <form> if missing.

TextInput.name: readonly
TextInput.description: Sets if the TextInput should be readonly, which will prevent further edits.

TextInput.name: name
TextInput.description: Sets the form name of the TextInput.

TextInput.name: max_length
TextInput.description: Sets the maximum amount of characters that the end-user CAN input, which will fail submission on a <form> if the input is invalid.

TextInput.name: min_length
TextInput.description: Sets the minimum amount of characters that the end-user MUST input, which will fail submission on a <form> if the input is invalid.

TextInput.name: pattern
TextInput.description: Sets a validation Regular Expression on TextInput, which will fail submission on a <form> if the input is invalid.

TextInput.name: placeholder
TextInput.description: Sets the text that is rendered if there is no current value.

TextInput.name: value
TextInput.description: Sets the text value of the TextInput.

TextInput.name: characters
TextInput.description: Sets the width of the TextInput to an approximation of the amount of characters to display.

TextInput.name: lines
TextInput.description: (TEXTAREA ONLY) Sets the height of the TextInput to an approximation of the amount of text lines to display.

TextInput.name: resizable
TextInput.description: (TEXTAREA ONLY) Sets if the TextArea should be resizable by the end-user.

TextInput.name: spell_check
TextInput.description: (TEXTAREA ONLY) Sets if Browser spellcheck should be enabled. Allows the Browser to automatically determine this, if unset.

snippets.title: TextInput Preview

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {
        Stack,
        TextInput,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Stack
    orientation="horizontal"
    alignment_y="top"
    spacing="medium"
    variation="wrap"
>
    <TextInput
        characters="20"
        value="This is a DEFAULT TextInput"
    />

    <TextInput
        palette="accent"
        characters="20"
        value="This is a ACCENT TextInput"
    />

    <TextInput
        palette="dark"
        characters="20"
        value="This is a DARK TextInput"
    />

    <TextInput
        palette="light"
        characters="20"
        value="This is a LIGHT TextInput"
    />

    <TextInput
        palette="alert"
        characters="20"
        value="This is a ALERT TextInput"
    />

    <TextInput
        palette="affirmative"
        characters="20"
        value="This is a AFFIRMATIVE TextInput"
    />

    <TextInput
        palette="negative"
        characters="20"
        value="This is a NEGATIVE TextInput"
    />
</Stack>

        characters="20"
        value="This is a ALERT TextInput"
    />

    <TextInput
        variation="block"
        palette="affirmative"
        characters="20"
        value="This is a AFFIRMATIVE TextInput"
    />

    <TextInput
        variation="block"
        palette="negative"
        characters="20"
        value="This is a NEGATIVE TextInput"
    />
</Stack>

TextInput Flush
TextInput Input Type

TextInput TextArea
TextInput Field Line Size
TextInput Resizable TextArea

data.render:
TextInput

TextInput is typically used for capturing string input from an end-user for input into forms, XHR requests, etc.

Imports

<script>
    import {TextInput} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

Palette

You can change the color palette of the TextInput via the palette property.

Size

You can change the size of the TextInput via the size property.

Block

You can alter the TextInput render as an opaque block via the variation property.

Flush

You can have the TextInput to be completely flush document text with no other stylings via the variation property.

Input Type

You can change your input type between email, password, search, text (DEFAULT), url via the type property.

Placeholder

You can set the TextInput to show placeholder text whenever there is no current value.

Field Character Size

You can set how wide your TextInput to an approximation of character width via the characters property.

TextArea

You can have the TextInput render as a <textarea> via the is property.

Field Line Size

You can set how tall your <textarea> based TextInput to an approximation of character lines via the lines property.

Resizable TextArea

You alter the a <textarea> based TextInput to resizable both axis true, horizontally x, and vertically y via the resizable property.
